        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at <!----></span>https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5"><!---->https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5<!----></a> so we can improve.<span class="line"><!----> so we can improve.<!----></span><br><br><br>************************* UNREPRODUCIBLE *************************<span class="line"><!---->************************* UNREPRODUCIBLE *************************<!----></span><br>Note: This crash might not be reproducible with the provided testcase. That said, for the past 14 days, we've been seeing this crash frequently.<span class="line"><!---->Note: This crash might not be reproducible with the provided testcase. That said, for the past 14 days, we've been seeing this crash frequently.<!----></span><br><br>It may be possible to reproduce by trying the following options:<span class="line"><!---->It may be possible to reproduce by trying the following options:<!----></span><br>- Run testcase multiple times for a longer duration.<span class="line"><!---->- Run testcase multiple times for a longer duration.<!----></span><br>- Run fuzzing without testcase argument to hit the same crash signature.<span class="line"><!---->- Run fuzzing without testcase argument to hit the same crash signature.<!----></span><br><br>If it still does not reproduce, try a speculative fix based on the crash stacktrace and verify if it works by looking at the crash statistics in the report. We will auto-close the bug if the crash is not seen for 14 days.<span class="line"><!---->If it still does not reproduce, try a speculative fix based on the crash stacktrace and verify if it works by looking at the crash statistics in the report.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br>Author: Vladimir Levin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Vladimir Levin &lt;<!----></span>vmpstr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/vmpstr@chromium.org"><!---->vmpstr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<!----></span><br><br>content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<span class="line"><!---->content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<!----></span><br>up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<span class="line"><!---->up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<!----></span><br>where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<span class="line"><!---->where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<!----></span><br>which should prevent us from having continuations.<span class="line"><!---->which should prevent us from having continuations.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>kojii@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/kojii@chromium.org"><!---->kojii@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>Fixed: 1197492<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1197492" title="Security:  Security DCHECK failed: !NeedsLayout() || ChildLayoutBlockedByDisplayLock() in blink::LayoutObject::AssertLaidOut"><!---->Fixed: 1197492<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I2d8386e480c48c97e77875d3f8d73ad3d419c18c<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I2d8386e480c48c97e77875d3f8d73ad3d419c18c<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2822899<a         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Drop files here to add them (Max: 10.0 MB per comment)
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;

          box-sizing: border-box;

        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br>Author: Vladimir Levin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Vladimir Levin &lt;<!----></span>vmpstr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/vmpstr@chromium.org"><!---->vmpstr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<!----></span><br><br>content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<span class="line"><!---->content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<!----></span><br>up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<span class="line"><!---->up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. containment<!----></span><br>which should prevent us from having continuations.<span class="line"><!---->which should prevent us from having continuations.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * is disabled for this component.

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          min-height: 100%;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

containment<!----></span><br>which should prevent us from having continuations.<span class="line"><!---->which should prevent us from having continuations.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br>Author: Vladimir Levin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Vladimir Levin &lt;<!----></span>vmpstr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/vmpstr@chromium.org"><!---->vmpstr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<!----></span><br><br>content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<span class="line"><!---->content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<!----></span><br>up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<span class="line"><!---->up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. containment<!----></span><br>which should prevent us from having continuations.<span class="line"><!---->which should prevent us from having continuations.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span source checkout.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br>Author: Vladimir Levin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Vladimir Levin &lt;<!----></span>vmpstr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/vmpstr@chromium.org"><!---->vmpstr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<!----></span><br><br>content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<span class="line"><!---->content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<!----></span><br>up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<span class="line"><!---->up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<!----></span><br>where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<span class="line"><!---->where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<!----></span><br>which should prevent us from having continuations.<span class="line"><!---->which should prevent us from having continuations.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 91.0.4469.4 (x86_64) + dev<!----></span><br>Revision: <span class="line"><!---->Revision: <!----></span>39da1ff31d2286d4681089eb431ccfe860ffbd26<a class="undefined"         Detailed Report: <span class="line"><!---->Detailed Report: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5637397615017984<a class="undefined" target="_blank" || ChildLayoutBlockedByDisplayLock() in layout_object.h<!----></span><br>  blink::LayoutObject::AssertLaidOut<span class="line"><!---->  blink::LayoutObject::AssertLaidOut<!----></span><br>         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br>Author: Vladimir Levin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Vladimir Levin &lt;<!----></span>vmpstr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/vmpstr@chromium.org"><!---->vmpstr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<!----></span><br><br>content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<span class="line"><!---->content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<!----></span><br>up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<span class="line"><!---->up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<!----></span><br>where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<span class="line"><!---->where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<!----></span><br>which should prevent us from having continuations.<span class="line"><!---->which should prevent us from having continuations.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span Linux-4.15.0-140-generic-x86_64-with-Ubuntu-18.04-bionic<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Load the attached test case with a chrome binary built with dchecks enabled:<span class="line"><!---->Load the attached test case with a chrome binary built with dchecks enabled:<!----></span><br><br><!DOCTYPE html><span source checkout.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8"><!---->8a60cb27f0476dd4248ac741b3c850889f1cc1a8<!----></a><br>Author: Vladimir Levin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Vladimir Levin &lt;<!----></span>vmpstr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/vmpstr@chromium.org"><!---->vmpstr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 14 15:51:40 2021<!----></span><br><br>content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<span class="line"><!---->content-visibility: Ensure to dirty continuations on force unlocks.<!----></span><br><br>This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<span class="line"><!---->This patch ensures that we propagate a dirty bit from the continuations<!----></span><br>up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<span class="line"><!---->up the ancestor chain when we do a force unlock. In "regular" cases<!----></span><br>where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<span class="line"><!---->where we don't need to force unlock anything, we have layout containment<!----></span><br>which should prevent us from having continuations.<span class="line"><!---->which should prevent us from having continuations.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>ikilpatrick@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ikilpatrick@chromium.org"><!---->ikilpatrick@chromium.org<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>kojii@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/kojii@chromium.org"><!---->kojii@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>Fixed: 1197492<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1197492" title="Security:  Security DCHECK failed: !NeedsLayout() || ChildLayoutBlockedByDisplayLock() in blink::LayoutObject::AssertLaidOut"><!---->Fixed: 1197492<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I2d8386e480c48c97e77875d3f8d73ad3d419c18c<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I2d8386e480c48c97e77875d3f8d73ad3d419c18c<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2822899<a            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * is disabled for this component.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {

 }

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
